intro: Hieracium goriense, commonly known as the Goriense hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh climates. Hieracium goriense is often found in meadows and open slopes at high elevations.
